newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee rises but rangebound in slow AM trade.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee rises but rangebound in slow AM trade.

text.p: LIFFE robusta coffee futures were modestly up but rangebound by Tuesday midsession with nearby months holding at session lows.
Conditions were slow and midday volume of a meagre 1,821 lots were dominated by May/July and July/Sept switches.
Floor sources said light fund buying emerged during mid-morning. However overhead trade selling prevented the market from making much headway.
By the midday pause, May stood $5 higher at $1,648. July gained $7 at $1,676 after a high of $1,685.
There has been a gradual unwinding of the May position ahead of its first tender day on May 1.
By the close of business on Monday, May's uncovered positions fell by 642 lots to 9,925. May/July switches were traded at $28 under and July/Sept $8-$10 under.
Traders called New York to open unchanged to one cent lower based on London's performance.
All eyes focussed on the ongoing Colombian truck drivers' strike which entered a third day on Tuesday.
Talks aimed at ending the strike ended with an agreement on Monday and both the government and the unions were due to resume negotiations on Tuesday.
Traders said coffee shipments could be disrupted if the stoppage is prolonged.
New York's front-month May position enters first notice day on Tuesday against the backdrop of low certified coffee stocks and high open interest.
Traders expect further liquidation against May after Monday's heavy bout of selling which took the U.S. market lower.
In London, the top of July's range was marked by a chart gap between Monday's high of $1,705 and the March 12 low of $1,730.
Strong support rested near $1,600, a level amid an area where several moving averages and trendlines meet, analysts said. -- Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 542 4985
